Node.definition: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
literally: a person of battle; hence: = a person that is of age and physically able to bear arms
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity

= action by which humans communicate with the spirit world using a variety of means such as inspecting the liver of animals, shaking arrows, consulting teraphim, or casting lots; ≈ usually regarded as an evil practice that is to be condemned; responsibility of a prophet or king

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state in which a countable entity is fifty in number

Node.gloss: to respect|to look upon or treat with favor|to honor
Node.definition: literally: to lift up (someone's) face; hence: = action by which humans or deities show favor or respect to someone, ◄ as if by allowing someone who is looking down out of shame or humility to look up directly into one's face
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= person with the skill to produce an artifact out of rough materials, such as stone, wood, metal

Node.gloss: to be intelligent|to be discerning|to have insight|to be an expert
Node.definition: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= an object that is thought to offer protection against evil
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
= a person who is nearing the end of a relatively long life; ≈ regarded as wise, worthy of respect, and an asset to the community

Node.gloss: to be of low esteem|to be held in contempt|to be degraded|to be humiliated
Node.definition: = state/process in wich humans provoke disdain from the general public ◄ due to their lower social standing, poverty, or condition; ≈ people in this situation are generally expected to pay respect to those of a higher standing

Node.gloss: to be honorable|to be worthy of honor|to be renowned
Node.definition: = state in which humans and deities are regarded as worthy of honor and respect
= son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not
literally: house; hence: = a group of people associated with a house, such as the family living there, or the descendants of the head of the household
= a group of people to which one traces one's ancestry; ◄ smallest unit within family group

= a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping
= a person who is acknowledged by a group as having authority over them ► to provide leadership, often in battle, and justice
= a building that has been destroyed or that has collapsed
literally: hand; hence: = state of being in a position of control and authority over objects or people
literally: to lift up (words); hence: = action by which humans utter certain words

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= action by which humans or deities hold a position of leadership and conduct the affairs of their subjects

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping

Node.gloss: to place (in a position) > to appoint
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities give (other) humans a certain task or responsibility
= a person who is acknowledged by a group as having authority over them ► to provide leadership, often in battle, and justice
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom

= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ fourth son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Leah (לֵאָה) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) which became a separate kingdom (opposed to Israel) after the death of Solomon (שְׁלֹמֹה) and, after the exile, a separate administrative district
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which an individual or nation loses power, prosperity or status
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
to stand in opposition or armed resistance to one's government or ruler, or to disobey or turn away from one's deity
literally: the eye (of an object); hence: = the part of an object that can be seen with the eye
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
literally: knowing (soneone's) face; hence: = action with which humans favor one side in a dispute over the other
= action by which humans provide evidence in court
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= town; ◄ located near Dead Sea (יָם־הַמֶּלַח) ► town where Lot (לֹוט) settled, when he separated himself from Abram (אַבְרָם) destroyed with Gomorrah (עֲמֹרָה)
= causative action by which humans refrain from sharing information with others
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= action by which humans or deities act towards a person in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: it is well (with someone); hence: = state in which people go through a time of relative prosperity
= the resulting effect of one's act or speech or decision
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil

Node.gloss: to eat the fruits > to bear the consequences
Node.definition: literally: to eat the fruits (of something); hence: = action by which someone accepts the consequences of an attitude or way of life ◄ as if they were the fruits of a tree; ≈ this expression can have both a positive or a negative sense
exclamation expressing grief and dismay

Node.gloss: to suffer (harm)|to go badly|to be in trouble
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience difficulty or hardship as a consequence for wrong or harmful behavior
= action by which humans act towards other humans or deities in a way that has consequences and can result either in retribution or a reward
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not
literally: to cause to go forward; hence: = to provide authority and give guidance to other people
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= a pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which someone causes a mind event not to produce the expected outcome
= state in which humans, deities or animals place themselves in a certain location in an upright position

Node.gloss: to plead (another's cause)|to defend|to take up (another's) cause
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities resolve a conflict for their own benefit or for the benefit of (other) humans who may not be in a position to do that for themselves
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to judge|to pass judgment|to vindicate|to rule
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensures that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in relief for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge

= a council or a group of older men who act with authority on behalf of or over their people; some represent an entire nation, others manage the affairs at the town level; some provide their leader with counsel; involved in both judicial and military decisions, and participating in cultic ceremonies; ≈ expected to be wise and considered worthy of deference and respect
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= referent to a group of male (and female) participants that are addressed if a discourse
= action by which someone removes things from a certain location with violence
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)
= objects taken unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= causative action by which humans reduce objects to tiny particles or powder with the help of a hand mill or larger millstone; ≈ regarded as a menial task|= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a linker introducing a proposition denoting the reason for what precedes

Node.gloss: to be exalted|to be proud|to be haughty|to be arrogant
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities have an elevated status, either in their own eyes or in the eyes of other people, ≈ which can either be good or bad, depending on whether this status is justified
literally: daughters of a town, region, nation; hence: = women that are inhabitants of a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the female offspring of that place
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: to stretch out (part of one's body)
Node.definition: literally: to stretch out (one's hand or neck); hence: = action by which humans straighten part of their body, such as their hands or necks

= the passage which leads from the back of the mouth of humans in the direction of the the lungs; ► internally, it functions as a passage way for food and breath; externally, it is a place around which ornaments can be placed; ≈ associated with food and speaking
= action by which humans look at other humans with lust

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= to walk in a distinctive manner ► to call attention to one's presumed attractiveness
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= causative action by which women cause their anklets to produce a tinkling sound ► in order to attract attention
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord
= upper part of the head; ≈ sometimes used in conjunction with feet (רֶגֶל) to refer to the whole physical body
literally: daughters of a town, region, nation; hence: = women that are inhabitants of a place, town, region, or nation, ◄ as if they were the female offspring of that place
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
exact meaning unknown; probably: = a part of the human body that is to the front; therefore, either the front of the head or the private parts
literally: to uncover; hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to take off their clothes and become (fully or partially) naked, ≈ which is regarded as shameful

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of אָדֹון (אָדֹון) = way of addressing God as master and lord

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= ornament; ◄ made of metal; ► worn around the ankle
= a narrow band of cloth, leather or other material, worn around the head
= ornaments in the curved shape of the waxing or waning moon
= ring; ◄ made out of silver or gold; ► worn for personal adornment, either in the ear or in the nose
= object made by an artist; ◄ usually made out of precious metal; ► worn on the arm as decoration or charm
= piece of cloth, worn by women around their head and shoulders ► for ornamentation
= head dress; ◄ made out of cloth; ► worn by priests, but also by ordinary men and women, probably on special occasions; not to be worn when in mourning; ≈ therefore associated with joy
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = part of female attire, worn around the body
literally: house (of an object); hence: = an object that serves as a holder or container of another object, ◄ as if it were its house
conjectured meaning: = some kind of airy substance, a scent of some sort
= an object that is thought to offer protection against evil

= a small circular band with an engraved design on the top; ◄ usually made of gold; ► worn on the finger and used as a marker of identity as well as for personal adornment; ≈ regarded as valuable and attractive
= ring; ◄ made out of silver or gold; ► worn for personal adornment, either in the ear or in the nose
= part of the body projecting above the mouth on the face of a person or animal, containing the two nostrils
= long garment of high quality, hanging down to the ankles, to be worn by priests or during festivities
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = overgarment that hangs loosely from the shoulders
exact meaning unsure; possible: = relatively large piece of fabric worn by women over the shoulders and/or head
= kind of receptacle; ◄ originally made out of bark; ► possibly used for carrying money
meaning unsure, possibly: = small, flat tablet with a polished or smooth surface; ◄ made out of metal, ► that reflects one's image
= an undergarment, ◄ woven of linen
= cloth wound around the head
exact meaning unsure; probably: = piece of cloth, worn by women around their head and shoulders as protection against the cold, and possibly for reasons of modesty as well

= generic terms for spices and aromatics, but sometimes specifically: fragrant resin ◄ produced by the balsam tree; ► used as ingredient for anointing oil and fragrant incense, and as perfume; ≈ considered very valuable
= something that is decomposing

= long, thin strip of material, worn around the waist; ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used either to cover one's nudity or to keep one's other clothes together; ≈ sometimes associated with honor and respect
= piece of cord; ◄ made by twisting together strands of hemp, sisal, flax, cotton, or similar material; ► used as a cheap alternative for a belt

= a hairless patch on the head of an animal or human being in a location where hair normally grows; ≈ this can be a natural phenomenon, as on the head of a vulture, but it can also be created by shaving the head as a sign of mourning
= state in which someone wears a piece of cloth around the waist
= a coarse dark material ◄ made of goat or camel hair; ► worn next to the skin as a sign of mourning or repentance
= state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye
= human beings, regardless of sex and age
= action by which humans are engaged in an armed conflict with other humans, accompanied by deeds of aggression
literally: to fall; hence: = process by which humans are killed or severely wounded by enemies
= people with the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= action by which humans give expression to their grief, ◄ caused by death of a relative or friend or by extreme hardship
= to experience grief and show this by one's actions; ◄ caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances
= the opening by which a person enters or exits an enclosed space, such as a house, a tent, a temple, or a larger area like a city; it can also be used figuratively to denote the mouth

Node.gloss: to be emptied|to be cleaned out
Node.definition: literally: to be cleaned out; hence: = causative action by which a city is deprived of its inhabitants

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
